name: Alexandr Antonov
about: Front-End Developer specializing in scalable React & TypeScript applications
summary: Detail-oriented Front-End developer with 3+ years of experience in large-scale e-commerce and startup environments. I specialize in building high-performing, scalable web applications using React and TypeScript. Demonstrated impact on architecture modernization, delivery speed, and user engagement. Open to remote work in international teams (EU/US).

work.title: Frontend Developer
work.description: A leading European e-commerce platform in the fashion and lifestyle sector.

bulletPoints.text: Refactored legacy React codebase to TypeScript, reducing bugs by 40% and cutting maintenance time by 35%
Connected REST APIs to Vite components, improving rendering performance by 25%
Increased the number of unit tests from 4678 to 5150 to improve code reliability
Collaborated remotely with 4 cross-functional teams using Agile methodology
Implemented accessibility improvements achieving WCAG 2.1 AA compliance

work.title: Web Developer
work.description: A Singapore startup specializing in building web and automation solutions for small and medium-sized businesses.

bulletPoints.text: Migrated the application from a monolithic architecture to micro-frontends, reducing cold build time by 26%
Reduced code review time by 44% by creating a corporate code style and integrating linter to CI
Created reusable React + TypeScript UI components, speeding up development and simplifying maintenance
Worked in Agile sprints, reviewed code, and improved CI/CD pipelines for faster release of updates
Optimized bundle size by 35% through code splitting and lazy loading

projects.title: FitLife - React Native Fitness App

bulletPoints.text: Created and launched a React Native app featuring adaptive training plans generated using artificial intelligence
Developed modular code and adaptive layouts to ensure the app could be scaled to support over 10,000 users
Implemented secure local storage, user profile management, and real-time UI interaction
